TITLE: Job openings nudged lower in November, down to 1.4 per available worker
SUMMARY: The JOLTS report showed employment listings nudged lower to 8.79 million, about in line with the Dow Jones estimate for 8.8 million.

TITLE: Saudi Arabia's sovereign wealth fund overtakes Singapore's GIC to top spending table
SUMMARY: Notable overseas investments in 2023 included Nintendo in Japan and Vale Basic Materials in Brazil.

TITLE: St. Louis Fed names former Tudor executive Alberto Musalem as new president
SUMMARY: Musalem, 55, will start on April 2. He replaces James Bullard, who joined Purdue University last August.

TITLE: Private payrolls added 164,000 in December, beating expectations, ADP says
SUMMARY: Private payrolls increased by 164,000 for the month, a substantial rise from the downwardly revised 101,000 in November.

TITLE: Job openings nudged down in November, down to lowest in more than two years
SUMMARY: The JOLTS report showed employment listings nudged lower to 8.79 million, about in line with the Dow Jones estimate for 8.8 million.

TITLE: Jobless rate for Black Americans declines to 5.2% to end 2023 on a positive note
SUMMARY: Black Americans, the group with the highest jobless percentage in the country, saw their jobless rate dip to 5.2% in December from 5.8% in the previous month.

TITLE: Here’s where the jobs are for December 2023 — in one chart
SUMMARY: Hiring for government jobs and health care led the gains to close out 2023.

TITLE: U.S. payrolls increased by 216,000 in December, much better than expected
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 170,000 in December, according to a Dow Jones consensus estimate.

TITLE: Friday's jobs report will be a big signal for a market looking for good news
SUMMARY: When the December jobs report is released Friday morning, markets will be looking for a number that hits a sweet spot.

TITLE: The 2023 U.S. economy, in a dozen charts
SUMMARY: The state of the U.S. economy may be a chief concern among Americans, but 2023 wound up as a pretty good year for the macroenvironment.

TITLE: Top Goldman Sachs analyst says the world is moving into a new super cycle
SUMMARY: The world economy is moving into a new so-called super-cycle, with AI and decarbonization being driving factors, a Goldman Sachs analyst says.

TITLE: Thursday's inflation report could challenge the market outlook for big Fed rate cuts
SUMMARY: The consumer price index is projected to have risen 0.2% in the final month of 2023, or 3.2% for the full year.

TITLE: Consumer spending rises in December to end solid holiday season, CNBC/NRF Retail Monitor shows
SUMMARY: Retailers chalked up solid gains in the final month to wrap up the holiday season, according to the CNBC/NRF Retail Monitor for December.

TITLE: Saudi Arabia nearly doubles estimate for the value of its mineral resources
SUMMARY: The Saudi government expects $20 billion in deals will be signed at the annual minerals forum in Riyadh this week.

TITLE: U.S. deficit tops half a trillion dollars in the first quarter of fiscal year
SUMMARY: The budget deficit totaled almost $510 billion, following a shortfall of $129.4 billion in December alone.

TITLE: Shipping boss says ongoing Red Sea disruption could have 'significant consequences' for global growth
SUMMARY: Maersk CEO Vincent Clerc said it was unclear whether Red Sea trade would resume in "days, weeks or months."

TITLE: Consumer prices rose 0.3% in December, higher than expected, pushing the annual rate to 3.4%
SUMMARY: The consumer price index for December was expected to increase 0.2% on a monthly basis and 3.2% from a year ago, according to Dow Jones.

TITLE: Turkish lira hits fresh record low against the U.S. dollar
SUMMARY: The beleaguered lira has fallen some 37% against the U.S. benchmark over the past year.

TITLE: Wholesale prices unexpectedly fall 0.1% in December in positive inflation sign
SUMMARY: The producer price index fell 0.1% for the month and ended 2023 up 1% from a year ago, the Labor Department reported Friday.

TITLE: Germany skirts recession at the end of 2023 but faces prolonged slump
SUMMARY: The estimate is in line with the expectations of analysts polled by Reuters.

TITLE: Fed's Christopher Waller advocates moving 'carefully' with rate cuts
SUMMARY: The comments, delivered during a speech in Washington, D.C., seemed to counter market anticipation for aggressing easing this year.

TITLE: Retail sales rose 0.6% in December, topping expectations for holiday shopping
SUMMARY: Retail sales increased 0.6% for the month, buoyed by a pickup in clothing and accessory stores as well as online nonstore businesses.

TITLE: Corporate debt defaults soared 80% in 2023 and could be high again this year, S&P says
SUMMARY: The number of companies that failed to make required payments on their debt totaled 153 for 2023, up from 85 the year before.

TITLE: Fed's Raphael Bostic expects rate cuts to happen in the third quarter
SUMMARY: The Atlanta Fed president said a "golden path" economic scenario is getting closer than many Fed officials had expected.

TITLE: Weekly jobless claims post lowest reading since September 2022
SUMMARY: Initial filings for unemployment insurance totaled 187,000 for the week ended Jan. 13.
